blurb: Go is a compiled, open source programming language with a small, consistent syntax, a powerful standard library, and fantastic tooling. It's a great fit for web backends and command-line tools.

key_features.title: Speed
key_features.content: Go is fast for computers and humans. Go provides fast compilation, testing, package mgmt, and more

key_features.title: Concurrency
key_features.content: Go's concurrency mechanisms make it easy to write programs for multicore and networked machines

key_features.title: Statically Typed
key_features.content: Go's type system is expressive yet lightweight, enabling flexible and modular program construction

key_features.title: Portable
key_features.content: Go compiles to a single static executable, and cross-compilation is easy

key_features.title: Minimal
key_features.content: Go's design reduces clutter and complexity. Your favorite feature may be missing, by design!

key_features.title: Modern
key_features.content: Go has > 1 million developers and every major cloud provider uses core infrastructure written in Go
